meanings.definition: An artificial waterway constructed for navigation, irrigation, or drainage.
meanings.sent1: The canal was built to help ships travel through the area.
meanings.sent2: The workers dug a canal to bring water to the fields.
meanings.sent3: Why did the boat refuse to go through the canal? It was too narrow!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a canal, guiding me through the rough waters of life.
meanings.sent5: The canal snaked through the city, a shimmering ribbon of hope.

meanings.definition: A tubular passage or channel within the body for carrying a fluid.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the ear canal helps us hear sounds.
meanings.sent2: She felt a tickle in her throat, as if something was stuck in the canal.
meanings.sent3: Why did the soda can roll into the ear canal? It wanted to hear the fizz!
meanings.sent4: His words flowed through her heart like a warm, comforting canal.
meanings.sent5: The blood rushed through the canal, carrying life to every corner of the body.
